titles.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located in Harlem, Montana, as the "Francis Bardanouve United States Post Office Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Mrs. Davis, Jo Ann moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2876.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services.

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Lieberman without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 337.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services
committee.name: Senate Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: 10/16/2001--Passed House without amendment. Designates the U.S. Postal Service facility located at 216 2nd Street, S.W. in Harlem, Montana, as the Francis Bardanouve United States Post Office Building.
